source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stipules ovate, prominently toothed; racemes 3–12-flowered, shorter than subtending leaves; calyx 10-nerved; pods more or less ovoid, acute, 5–8 mm long, concentrically ridged

Stipules lanceolate, entire or broader and toothed towards the base; racemes 10–100-flowered, longer than subtending leaves; calyx 5-nerved; pods more or less globose, obtuse, 2–5 mm long, reticulate- or transverse-wrinkled
Plant annual; stipules dilated and usually toothed towards base; flowers yellow, 2–3 mm long; pods c. 2 mm long
Plant annual or biennial; stipules entire; flowers white, 4–7 mm long; pods 3–5 mm long
